job.title: Entry Level Software Engineer
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Higher Education,Computer Software
job.description:
Accepted candidates will enter LC101, LaunchCode's flagship programming course designed to teach skills that are in high demand in the tech industry. LC101 provides a supportive virtual classroom environment with live mentoring from instructors, teaching fellows, and local engineers. Throughout the 20-week course, students will meet Mondays and Thursdays from 6:30-9:30pm from September 20, 2021 through March 2022. This course is completely free, with ample support from knowledgeable and passionate teaching staff, with an exciting professional opportunity waiting at the finish line: an apprenticeship with World Wide Technology!
Following LC101, students who have completed all assignments will begin a three-month apprenticeship as a Software Engineer at World Wide Technology. In this role, apprentices will be an active, productive member of an Agile/Scrum team. They will code, test, debug, and deliver software in a team-based environment. Throughout the apprenticeship, candidates will work full-time making $20/hour plus health insurance benefits. At the end of the 12-week period, successful apprentices will have the opportunity to convert to permanent employees at World Wide Technology, with a salary boost to $65,000+ and benefits.
